extendedIngredients.name: new potatoes
extendedIngredients.original: 2 (15 oz) cans whole new potatoes , drained

title: Pacific Pesto Grilled Halibut
summary: Pacific Pesto Grilled Halibut might be just the main course you are searching for. This recipe makes 1 servings with 1540 calories, 146g of protein, and 38g of fat each. For $29.73 per serving, this recipe covers 65% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free, dairy free, and pescatarian diet. 1 person found this recipe to be delicious and satisfying. It is brought to you by Recipezaar. It is perfect for The Fourth Of July. Head to the store and pick up jalapeno, lime juice, halibut steaks, and a few other things to make it today. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 15 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 84%, this dish is super. Try Pacific Pesto Grilled Halibut, Grilled Pacific Halibut with Rhubarb Compote and Balsamic Strawberries, and Pacific Halibut In Green Tea Broth for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Halibut on the menu? Try pairing with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Grüner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. One wine you could try is Menage a Trois Limelight Pinot Grigio. It has 4.5 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 11 dollars.

productMatches.title: Menage a Trois Limelight Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: Ménage à Trois Limelight shines a spotlight on refreshing citrus flavors in the most dazzling way. Limelight is a new star with sexy orange blossom aromas that lead to zesty key lime and mouthwatering Granny Smith apple flavors that make you pucker up. A touch of honeysuckle sweetness and minerality balance the pronounced citrus notes before the curtains drop with a refreshingly crisp finish.

instructions: Preheat broiler. In a food processor or blender, combine the cilantro, garlic, lime zest and juice, jalapeo, and soy sauce. Blend until mixed. With processor or blender running, gradually pour in the oil and process until thickened.Place the fish steaks on a greased broiler pan. Brush top of each steak with the sauce. Coat the potatoes with remaining sauce; place in broiler pan with the fish.Broil about 10 minutes, or until fish flakes with a fork.

steps.step: Preheat broiler. In a food processor or blender, combine the cilantro, garlic, lime zest and juice, jalapeo, and soy sauce. Blend until mixed. With processor or blender running, gradually pour in the oil and process until thickened.
Place the fish steaks on a greased broiler pan.
Brush top of each steak with the sauce. Coat the potatoes with remaining sauce; place in broiler pan with the fish.Broil about 10 minutes, or until fish flakes with a fork.
